moves.1. e4: Typical move for a reason. This move controls the centre and gets the queen and bishop ready for action.
moves.1... a5: I don't see how this helps with development. Does anyone know?
moves.3. Nf3: I have heard that it is a bad idea to do Nc3 after d4. Why?
moves.3... Na6: Knights are almost always best when pointing towards the centre.
moves.4. Bc4: I decide to target the f-pawn.
moves.4... Nh6: At this point, one would say that white is much more able to launch an attack, though white would be unwise to attack without much support.
moves.5. O-O: I castle, putting my king into a safer position (which is generally the aim of castling).
moves.5... g6 6. Bg5: Is this OK, or is Bf4 better?
moves.8... f6: As I feared after pressing 'Submit' on move 6.
moves.9. Bxh6: Aiming for liquidation, but is this a bad move, because it trades a bishop for a badly placed knight and allows the DSB a more active role in the game?
moves.10. e5: Trying to give my knight on f3 attacking space.
moves.10... Bg7 11. e6: Is this OK? dxe6 is illegal, as d7 is pinned.
moves.11... c6 12. exd7+: Check. My bishop still has time to move.
moves.12... Qxd7 13. Bc4: Bxa6 is probably better, due to Rxb2.
moves.14. h3: ? I had an irrational fear of a pawn storm, which is why I did this.
moves.14... Rh5: ?? Loses a knight, as you will see.
moves.15. Qd3: Black resigned here, facing either Bxa6 (winning the knight) or Qxg6+ (forking the king and rook). Feel free to comment and offer constructive criticism, and I hope that you learned something! 😄
